Major_Arcs.title: Setting the Scene and Initial Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the main characters, settings, and initial conflicts, including romantic refusals, the mystery of Ghost Town, and the disruption caused by modern development plans.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Refusal and Ghost Town Mystery
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the main character in a saloon setting and hints at an underlying mystery related to 'Ghost Town'.

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town Past and Present
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene contrasts a nostalgic flashback of Ghost Town with the modern-day threat of its destruction.

narrative_arcs.title: Modern Day Disruption: Airport Plans for Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Romantic and Practical Conflicts
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene explores the clash between romantic ideals and practical realities, especially concerning Ghost Town's fate and personal relationships.

narrative_arcs.title: Encounter with Construction Workers and Disdain

sub_scenes.title: Business and Family Tensions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to family dynamics, business discussions related to the airport, and escalating tensions between Nan and her father.

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Doubts and Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Nan's emotional turmoil regarding Cal, conflicting advice from family, and her decision to seek direct clarification from Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Horses to the Airport and the Deal

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confession and Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Nan's emotional confession to Cal, his somewhat detached response, and the ambiguous outcome of their interaction.

Major_Arcs.title: Weather Crisis and Community Response
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the sudden onset of severe winter weather, the community's struggle with the crisis, and the eventual relief provided by external aid.

sub_scenes.title: Winter Weather and Initial Concerns
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the sudden change in weather, initial reports of heavy snowfall, and growing concerns about livestock and fodder.

narrative_arcs.title: Recollections of Changed Weather and Difficult Journey
Seeking Comfort and Reassurance Amidst Hardship
Recalling Past Winter's Severity and Impending Starvation
Riding Out to Face the Crisis and Uncertain Future

sub_scenes.title: Hope and Relief in the Snow
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the community's initial response to the snow, their growing despair, and the unexpected arrival of aid from the sky.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Restlessness and Persistent Snowfall
The Sound of Hope: Arrival of a Plane
Relief from the Sky and Reflections on Romance

Major_Arcs.title: Chane Benson and Juniper Town Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and explores conflicts in Juniper Town, involving themes of violence, hero worship, newspaper rivalry, and romantic entanglements.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Chane Benson
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Chane Benson through a dramatic showdown in a Western town, establishing his character and reputation.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff and Gun Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Jeff's fascination with guns and his hero worship, leading to a tense confrontation with Sally.

narrative_arcs.title: Advice on Decency and Confrontation with Benson

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Worries and Clyde's Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Sally's deep concerns about Jeff's behavior and her conversation with Clyde, seeking reassurance and guidance.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern Over Jeff's Gun Obsession and Control
Reassurance and Premonition of Finding Jeff
Clyde's Retrospective Account of Jeff's Disappearance
Introducing Mr. Benson and Casual Banter
Mr. Benson's Ominous Tone Shift and Mention of Death

sub_scenes.title: Article Controversy and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene revolves around Clyde's controversial article about Benson, the reactions to it, and the decision to invite Chane Benson for dinner.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Justification for Writing About Benson
Sally's Distrust and Ominous Description of Benson
Benson's Threat to Clean Up Juniper Town
Flashback to Benson's Articles and Consequences
Considering Inviting Chane Benson for Dinner
Sally's Persuasion and Jeff's Agreement to Invite Chane
Invitation to Dinner and Observation of Chane's Demeanor
Discussion on Chane's Artistic Skills and Character

sub_scenes.title: Dinner, Jealousy and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the dinner with Chane Benson, escalating tensions due to jealousy, misunderstanding, and Chane's unwanted advance.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane's Confrontation and Accusation of Trap
Sally's Accusation and Demand for Honesty
Sally's Angry Explanation to Jeff about Chane's Actions and Intentions

sub_scenes.title: Fight and Chase
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the physical confrontation between Jeff and Chane, and the ensuing chase after Chane when Sally warns of his malicious intent.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane's Angry Confrontation and Jeff's Punch
Sally's Desperate Plea and Jeff's Fall
Urgent Warning and Chase After Chane

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Newspaper
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes the conflict with Chane Benson, showing his defeat and the subsequent dedication of Jeff and Clyde to their newspaper.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Conflict and Betsy-Steve Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new setting at a ranch, focusing on a range war, Betsy's leadership, and her burgeoning romance with Steve Daley amidst conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Introduction and Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the ranch setting, introduces Betsy and Steve Daley, and hints at an existing conflict on the ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation and Approbation of Steve Daley's Hiring

sub_scenes.title: Range War and Town Trip
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the escalating range war, Betsy's preparations, and her journey into town with Steve, where her feelings begin to shift.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of Accommodation and Lingering Doubts
Journey into Town and Expressed Gratitude
Hank's Orders and Material for a Dress

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Gunfight
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy's activities in town and a violent confrontation with Fred Bridges, escalating into an imminent gunfight.

sub_scenes.title: Gunslinger Decision and Father's Approval
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy's firm decision to hire a gunslinger, her father's eventual approval, and Hank's misunderstanding.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Firm Decision to Hire a Gunslinger
Justification and Acceptance from Authority Figure
Hank's Concern and Betsy's Softened Stance

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Confessions
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the developing romance between Betsy and Steve, culminating in mutual confessions of love and commitment.

narrative_arcs.title: Sudden Intense Feelings and Mutual Confession

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Confrontation and Horse Theft
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Old Man Bridges' arrival at the ranch, a tense confrontation, and the subsequent theft of horses, escalating the range war.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Arrival and Ranch Hands' Confrontation
Betsy's Warning and Steve's Determination Amidst Threats
Betsy's Assertion of Authority on Gun Use
Aftermath: Horse Theft and Realization of Loss

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit and Rescue at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Betsy's emotional reaction to the horse theft, Steve's departure to retrieve the horses, and Betsy's pursuit to Devil's Pass, culminating in a rescue and reunion.

narrative_arcs.title: Ride to Devil's Pass and Arrival at Gunfire Scene
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Fred, and Dave Love Triangle Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the complex love triangle between Carrie, Fred, and Dave, and the eventual resolution of their romantic entanglements and business conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Rancher's Daughter and Personal Conflicts
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Carrie (the Rancher's daughter) and hints at personal and ranch-related conflicts affecting her and her family.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Concerns about Curley and Outsiders

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Gunpoint
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details a dispute over fencing and water access, escalating to a gunpoint confrontation involving Curley and Fred Gordon.

sub_scenes.title: Apologies and Reconciliation Attempt
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows initial attempts at reconciliation and shifts to Carrie and Dave's complex relationship dynamics and unresolved feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confessions and Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features escalating emotional confrontations, Carrie's clarifications of her feelings, and ultimately a marriage proposal from Fred Gordon.

sub_scenes.title: Contract and Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the Carlton contract as a point of contention, leading to accusations of betrayal and further emotional turmoil for Carrie and Dave.

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Meeting and Victory
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Carrie and Fred's meeting with Mr. Carlton regarding the contract, leading to a successful outcome and a business victory for Carrie.

narrative_arcs.title: Assertion of Independence and Business Acumen

sub_scenes.title: Final Confessions and Rejections
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene brings closure to the love triangle as Carrie makes final declarations about her feelings, leading to Dave's resigned departure and Carrie's reflection.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Intuition and Long Ride Reflection

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Climax and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene concludes Carrie and Fred's romantic storyline with misunderstandings cleared, confessions of love, and a passionate resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Revelation of Fred's Arrival and Misunderstanding
Carlton's Explanation of the Beef Contract
Realization of Foolishness and Seeking Reassurance
Affectionate Embrace and Plea for Kiss

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk, Chris, and Rance Conflict and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows the complex relationship between Dirk, Chris, and Marshal Rance, involving themes of mistaken identity, legal conflict, moral dilemmas, and unexpected romantic resolutions.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Injury and Grandfather's Concern
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Dirk's injury, his urgent need for help, and his grandfather's growing concern and plan to investigate.

narrative_arcs.title: Revelation of Dirk's Injury and Medical Examination

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Encounter and Misunderstanding
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the Marshal's arrival at the ranch, a case of mistaken identity, and initial tensions with the ranch owner and Chris Ransome.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Confrontation and Demand for Authority

sub_scenes.title: Accusation, Standoff and Truce
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene clarifies the accusation against Dirk, leading to a tense standoff and a temporary truce for Dirk's recovery.

narrative_arcs.title: Law vs. Justice and Dirk's Injury

sub_scenes.title: Love Confessions and Jealousy
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene features Chris's confession of love to the Ranch Owner, her internal conflict, and Rance's jealous intervention, creating a love triangle.

narrative_arcs.title: Plea for Understanding and Escape Plan

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Pursuit and Gunfight
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Dirk and Chris's escape attempt, the relentless pursuit by the Marshal, and the violent confrontation that ensues.

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath and Rance-Woman Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene resolves the immediate conflict, showing the aftermath of the gunfight, Dirk's escape to Mexico, and the romantic resolution between Rance and the Ranch Owner.

narrative_arcs.title: Leaving the Wounded Marshal and Woman's Reflection
Dirk's Farewell and Escape to Mexico
Chris's Return to Rance and Woman's Thoughts
Rance's Pursuit and Dirk's Escape Confirmed
Clearing Chris's Name and Woman's Forgiveness
Confession of Love and Lingering Fear
Confrontation and Clarification at the Wedding
